author: Iboyaima Laithangbam
text:
Seven persons, including a 17-year-old girl, were killed and over 120 seriously injured as a major earthquake hit Manipur and neighbouring States early on Monday, damaging hundreds of houses, government offices, schools and hospitals. The epicentre of the quake, measuring 6.7 on the Richter scale, was Noney in Tamenglong district, about 35 km from Imphal. Two teams of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) were deployed in coordination with the Army and the Air Force and rapid action squads of the State Health Department were despatched to the affected areas. A round-the-clock helpline has been set up.

“The epicentre is in Kabuikhullen village and Pongailong, about seven and 2 km respectively from Noney. But no one is aware of these villages which are nearly destroyed. Many are injured and houses have collapsed but none of the relief teams has reached these areas,” said Kanarjit Kangujam of Youth Disaster Response Team. Sangruah Gangmei, secretary of All Zeliangrong Students Union, said “many churches, schools and houses” have collapsed in Noney.

Despite the severe weather, people are spending the night in the open beside log fires as houses have collapsed and aftershocks continued through the day.

In the capital Imphal, the Minuthong bridge linking the east and west districts was damaged, disrupting road connectivity.
title: 7 killed as 6.7 magnitude quake jolts Manipur
